article:
{{nutritional value
 | name=Whey, sweet, fluid, image= caption=Whey collecting as newly made cheese
 | drains kJ=112 protein=0.846 g fat=0.36 g carbs=5.14 g calcium_mg=47 right=1
}}

'Whey' or 'Milk Serum' is the liquid remaining after milk has been curdled and
strained. It is a by-product of the manufacture of cheese or casein and has
several commercial uses. Sweet whey is manufactured during the making of rennet
types of hard cheese like cheddar or Swiss cheese. Acid whey (also known as
"sour whey") is obtained during the making of acid types of cheese such as
cottage cheese.
